bwwExcerpt: "Since the action of No Man's Land consists mostly of drinking, the slipperiness of identity may have a physiological basis. Of course, this being Pinter, there's external menace as well. Two slimy men who live in Hirst's house-played by Shuler Hensley and Billy Crudup-are sometimes said to be family, sometimes paid caretakers, but mostly seem like enforcers, procurers, or (in Crudup's case) a rent boy. (Crudup gives this past-prime peacock a wonderfully moronic little giggle.)...For if No Man's
